result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathon J. Stone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jonathon J. Stone is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jonathon J. Stone was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Jonathon J. Stone was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathon J. Stone

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on July 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
After court, it was determined that 15tr2671 was a fail to pay - not a current citation. Judge O'Melia cancelled warrant and JA will provide new review date.

2:25 p.m. Defendant Jonathon J. Stone in court in cuwith attorney Jeffrey Jazgar.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf08, 16cf13 and 15tr2671. Schiek states agreement. In 16cf08 State moves to dismiss Count 1 and 3 - Granted. State moves to amend Count 1 in 16cf13 to Misdemeanor - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Jazgar/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. Victim rights legislation has been complied with. State moves to dismiss 15tr2671 - Granted. 
Court Sentence 
WHS/POP - 2 years each count - CC
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample 
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Jail Credit - 20 days if revoked - each case
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 2:41 p.m.

3:39 p.m. Defendant Jonathon J. Stone in custody in court with attorney Jeffrey Jazgar.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf13 and 16cf08 and 15tr2672 and 15tr2671. In 16cf08 - - Arraignment - in receipt of Information - waives further reading - enters not guilty plea. Jazgar motion to modify bond - Schiek statement to bond - Court denies motion and cash bond to remain. In 16cf13 - Schiek statement that felony to be amended to misdemeanor. Bail continued. Adj. 3:45 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jonathon J. Stone in court with attorney Jeffrey Jazgar.  Defendant Jonathon J. Stone in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Calling 16cf13 and 16cf8 as well as 15tr2672,2671 - 
  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. - 16cf13 to be put over for status - -possible charging issues-
Information filed in 16cf8 - Waive reading -
Bail continued  Arraignment scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

2:57 p.m. Defendant Jonathon J. Stone in court via video with attorney Jeffrey Jazgar via telephone with leave of court.  Defendant Jonathon J. Stone in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf08 and 16cf13. In both cases, in receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued. Adj. 2:59 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

2:38 p.m. Defendant Jonathon J. Stone in court, in custody, via video.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf13, 16cf08. Defendant states he contacted PD's office - has an attorney appointed, Patricia Judge. Attorney Burns statement that she was unaware that appointment had been made. Bail continued. Adj. 2:41 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

2:59 p.m. Defendant Jonathon J. Stone in court, via video, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf08, 16cf13, 15tr2672, 15tr2671. Defendant states he contacted public defender - Attorney Hogan appearing specially. Hogan statement to attempt to find representation but there are 8 co-defendants and many conflicts. Bail continued. Adj. 3:00 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

1:55 p.m. MJB for PFO. Defendant Jonathon J. Stone, via video, in custody, in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 16cf13, 16cf08, 15tr2672, 15tr 2671, 15tr1562, 15tr1561 and 12fa63. In 16cf13, in receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Bednar statement to bail - Court sets $  bond Off record at 2:00 p.m. to straighten out video problems with jail. On record 2:02 p.m. - by video and telephone. In 12fa63, Defendant in court via video and telephone. Tom Wiensch for Oneida County. Defendant Jonathan Defendant provides current address.  Defendant thought child support proceedings were on 14th - Wiensch questions whether defendant appeared on 14th - Wiensch statement to case - hearing set for January 28, 2016 at 8:30 a.m. in Branch 2 - Court sets $5,000 cash bond. 
16cf08 - set for Initial appearance to track with 16cf13 - no bond set in that case.  
Court quashes all warrants/capias. 
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Assigned to Branch I at the initital appearance.
